snippet.title: [Longplay] SNES - Super Mario World: The Second Reality Project Reloaded [Hack] [100%] (4K, 60FPS)
snippet.description:
Played by xRavenXP (me)

This is the longplay of The Second Reality Project Reloaded, a hack of the Super Mario World game made by FPI in 2008 and that is a totally improved remake of the version The Second Reality Project.

"Bowser came back and this time more powerful than before.He found a source of energy that allows him to repair his fleet of aircraft.With this he plans on attacking the Mushroom Kingdom once again! Mario time to figure this out! "

Faced with this, Mario has to go through many stages to the best style of the original version, but the story even a bit of science fiction. In this game, the author used the graphics redrawn, but without changing the look of the player. The background images are well done, matching the level style and the songs. Also, this hack does not use HDMA (maybe because it was not possible at the time, probably).
The songs are mostly custom, so there are few who remember other mario franchise games (like Super Mario Land). They match very well with the stages, generally improving the experience with most of them. The game is quite beautiful, but also very long and finding all the exits and portals is quite a challenge. The video was done achieving all 117 exits. Hope you like it.
